ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Finding a guild
ygData.msgSnippet: Hahaha Yeah and I met one on Saturday .. been trying to think of her name all day!  Was pretty funny, this bard in our extremely UNBALANCED group turns out to
ygData.messageBody:
Hahaha Yeah and I met one on Saturday .. been trying to think of her name
all day! Was pretty funny, this bard in our extremely UNBALANCED group
turns out to be Meara's friend :-) Small world!

Hally/Tani
Solusek ro

-----Original Message-----
From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
Sent: Monday, May 15, 2000 3:15 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Finding a guild

You can get to know your guild pretty well from guildchat
even without being
like-levels
I've spent a year now in Phoenix (A high level guild on
SoluSek Ro) And my
best friends there are 50+s that I have never grouped with.
However, if you
are looking for a guild for groupage, this isn't going to
work for you.

Sarah Heacock sarah@...
Meara Daring, level 25 Enchanter, Master Jeweler, owner
Meara's Boutique of
Mystiques, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
Faerain Wanderer, level 20 Soldier of Tunare, Phoenix,
Solusek Ro /
Faesong, level 17 HalfElf Bard of Solusek Ro, Phoenix,
Solusek Ro (Qeynos) /
<lvl 6 paladin -- baby BASHer!>

>-----Original Message-----
>From: Jeff Heskett [mailto:tarkin@...]
>Sent: Monday, May 15, 2000 2:15 PM

>this is so true.
>
>A LOT of the comraderie will come from having levelled up
with guildmates.
>you'll spend a lot of time with them. if you're in a guild
that has the
>numbers and the good people but it's hard to get a group,
you'll find
>yourself in pickup groups and getting to know everyone but
your guild it
>seems.
